The aim of the game is to be the first player to get rid of all your cards.

Starting the Game: All players start out with 7 cards in their hand. The rest of the deck is placed in the center as a draw pile. The top four cards are placed face up around the draw pile, one card on each side.

On Your Turn: You begin your turn by drawing a card. Cards are played from your hand in descending order of value and alternating colored suits on top of the four stacks around the draw pile. Kings are the exception and can be played on the corners of the draw pile. Cards can also be moved from one pile to another following the same rules. If a pile is empty as a result, any card can be played there.

Ending Your Turn: Your turn is over when you can not play any cards or move any piles. To end your turn, press Menu and select End Turn.

Single Player: This starts a 2 player game with one player controlled by the computer. Your hand is shown at the bottom of the screen and the back of the computer\'s hand is shown at the top of the screen.\n\nMulti-player: This allows you to pick the number of players (from 2-4), all controlled by human players.
There are two different game modes to choose from: Single Player and Multi-player.
Things that are helpful but may not be completely obvious.

Instead of playing a card in an empty space then moving a pile on top of it, you can play the card directly under a pile. This move will not be highlighted and only works when there is at least one empty space.

Autosave will save the game automatically when you quit. It also saves the game when you switch to another application, press the home button, and after each player's turn. This way there is little chance of losing your progress.

Any dialog, besides "Player x's turn", can be canceled by pressing the back button. This will remove the dialog box without performing any actions.
